doc.field: This subseries contains 7 linear feet of press releases and radio beepers sent out by Brademas' office to members of the press, as well as material used by Brademas and his staff to prepare releases and beepers, including news clippings, transcripts of speeches, press releases from other offices on the same issue, and pamphlets and other informational material on the same subject. Files often include several drafts of each press release, ranging from longhand versions by Brademas or his staff, to handwritten or typed revisions. Campaign press releases covering specific campaign issues and events are filed together with regular press releases and beepers. Files are arranged chronologically. An index arranged alphabetically by subject and/or date precedes press releases from 1969, 1970, 1971, 1972, and 1978.

Following the Press Releases are Congressional Corners, weekly reports written by John Brademas "exclusively for the weekly newspapers of the Third Congressional District." Beginning on the week of March 16, 1969 and ending the week of October 4, 1976, these weekly press communications detail the events of the past week in Congress, summarizing important issues, votes, and legislation, with commentary by JB. The contents of this sub-series are arranged chronologically by month and year.
